poem:
**Sculptors of Clay**

Women,
they mold futures,
tender hands on cool clay.
Their choices chisel freedom,
brimming,
undaunted by the murmur of chains.
Men,
let no shadow suppress
your sunlit craft.
Together,
we shape the horizon,
carving our humanity
in the soft amber of dawn.
